item.title: godocs.io one year later
item.description: It's been more than a year since we started godocs.io. For those unaware, godocs.io is a fork of the now-defunct godoc.org which serves documentation for Go packages. Some users may prefer godocs.io for its lightweight pages, simpler user interface, lower resource consumption, or ability to render documentation regardless of project license. I am pleased to announce version 1.0 of gddo, the software which powers it all. Since forking, we've made many improvements. As a result, gddo now supports:
